turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Lower South Grape Creek School (Gillespie County, Texas).
turn.1: Where is the Lower South Grape Creek School located?
turn.2: Lower South Grape Creek School (Gillespie County, Texas) Lower South Grape Creek School is located at 10273 E U.S. Highway 290 in Gillespie County, Texas.
turn.4: In 1960, the school was consolidated with Fredericksburg Independent School District.
turn.5: What is the school building used for today?
turn.6: The building is now used as a community center.
turn.8: The school was designated a Recorded Texas Historic Landmark in 1994, Marker number 10073.
turn.9: Was the landmark recognized by any other organizations?
turn.10: It was added to the National Register of Historic Places in Texas on May 6, 2005. Luckenbach was settled on the Pedernales tributary of Grape Creek by German colonists such as the Luckenbach family, who arrived in Texas from Stein-Wingert, Germany, aboard the "Brig Johann Dethardt" January 12, 1846.
turn.11: When did the family settle in Texas?
turn.12: They were among the first wave of colonists to Fredericksburg in 1846.
